name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl has three benzene rings connected in a linear fashion. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969).
